class nautical.noaa.ncei.base.Parameter(param: str, data: str)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to track the query parameters that can and will exist at the end of the API queries. For instance:

datatypeid=EMNT

Check that the type(s) of the parameters are all of the type Parameter from this module.

Parameters:

parameters – List of Parameters or Parameter object

Returns:

True when all parameters are of type Parameter

nautical.noaa.ncei.base._query(token, endpoint, limit=1, offset=1)[source]¶

Execute the POST request/query

Parameters:

  • token – Authentication token

  • endpoint – Endpoint to query

  • limit – Number of results to accept. Max of 1000

  • offset – Entry offset used to determine which results to accept

Returns:

JSON object representing the result of the query

nautical.noaa.ncei.base.get_num_results(token, endpoint)[source]¶

Query the API provided with the correct endpoint and authentication token to find the number of possible results from a query.

Parameters:

  • token – HTTP athentication token

  • endpoint – Full http endpoint where the get request will fetch information from.

Returns:

Number of expected results

nautical.noaa.ncei.base.query_all(token, obj_type=<class 'nautical.noaa.ncei.base.NCEIBase'>, parameters=None)[source]¶

Run the common query all for an end node

Parameters:

  • token – Token for authentication

  • obj_type – Class for the type of data to be returned.

  • parameters – List or single Parameter object(s) that will be used for the query.

Returns:

unordered list of json strings containing the individual results from each query.

Raises:

  • AttributeError – If endpoint of the class type is not set

  • AttributeError – If class type does not have a variable parameters

  • TypeError – If parameters does not contain only type Parameter

nautical.noaa.ncei.base.query_base(token, endpoint, obj_type=<class 'nautical.noaa.ncei.base.NCEIBase'>, limit=1, offset=1)[source]¶

Query the API provided with the correct endpoint and authentication token.

Parameters:

  • token – HTTP athentication token

  • endpoint – Full http endpoint where the get request will fetch information from.

  • obj_type – Class type that will be used to make the objects

  • limit – Number of results to yield. The API only allows for a max value of 1000

  • offset – The location offset where the results will begin.

Returns:

Json encoded result of the query

nautical.noaa.ncei.data module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.data.Data(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

The data endpoint is used for actually fetching the data.

Additional Query Parameters

datasetid [Optional]

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Data returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

datatypeid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data type id or a chain of data type ids separated by ampersands. Data returned will contain all of the data type(s) specified

locationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location ids separated by ampersands. Data returned will contain data for the location(s) specified

stationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid station id or a chain of of station ids separated by ampersands. Data returned will contain data for the station(s) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

units [Optional]

Accepts the literal strings ‘standard’ or ‘metric’. Data will be scaled and converted to the specified units. If a unit is not provided then no scaling nor conversion will take place.

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

includemetadata [Optional]

Defaults to true, used to improve response time by preventing the calculation of result metadata.

attributes¶
datatype¶
date¶
endpoint = 'https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/cdo-web/api/v2/data'¶
parameters = ('datasetid', 'datatypeid', 'locationid', 'stationid', 'startdate', 'enddate', 'units', 'sortfield', 'sortorder', 'limit', 'offset', 'includemetadata')¶
station¶
value¶

nautical.noaa.ncei.datacategories module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.datacategories.DataCategory(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

Data Categories represent groupings of data types.

Additional Parameters

datasetid [Optional]

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Data categories returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

locationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location ids separated by ampersands. Data categories returned will contain data for the location(s) specified

stationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid station id or a chain of of station ids separated by ampersands. Data categories returned will contain data for the station(s) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data categories returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data categories returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

nautical.noaa.ncei.datasets module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.datasets.Dataset(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

All of the CDO data are in datasets. The containing dataset must be known before attempting to access its data.

Additional Parameters

datatypeid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data type id or a chain of data type ids separated by ampersands. Datasets returned will contain all of the data type(s) specified

locationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location ids separated by ampersands. Datasets returned will contain data for the location(s) specified

stationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid station id or a chain of of station ids separated by ampersands. Datasets returned will contain data for the station(s) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Datasets returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Datasets returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

nautical.noaa.ncei.datatypes module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.datatypes.DataType(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

Describes the type of data, acts as a label. If it’s 64°f out right now, then the data type is Air Temperature and the data is 64.

Additional Parameters

datasetid [Optional]

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Data types returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

locationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location ids separated by ampersands. Data types returned will contain data for the location(s) specified

stationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid station id or a chain of of station ids separated by ampersands. Data types returned will contain data for the station(s) specified

datacategoryid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data category id or a chain of data category ids separated by ampersands (although it is rare to have a data type with more than one data category). Data types returned will be associated with the data category(ies) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data types returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Data types returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

datacoverage¶
endpoint = 'https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/cdo-web/api/v2/datatypes'¶
id¶

mindate¶
name¶
parameters = ('datasetid', 'locationid', 'stationid', 'datacategoryid', 'startdate', 'enddate', 'sortfield', 'sortorder', 'limit', 'offset')¶

Bases: NCEIBase

Location categories are groupings of locations under an applicable label.

Additional Parameters

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Location categories returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Location categories returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Location categories returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

nautical.noaa.ncei.locations module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.locations.Location(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

Locations can be a specific latitude/longitude point such as a station, or a label representing a bounding area such as a city.

Additional Parameters

datasetid [Optional]

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Locations returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

locationcategoryid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location category ids separated by ampersands.Locations returned will be in the location category(ies) specified.

datacategoryid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data category id or an array of data category ids. Locations returned will be associated with the data category(ies) specified

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Locations returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Locations returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

nautical.noaa.ncei.stations module¶

class nautical.noaa.ncei.stations.Station(json_data=None)[source]¶

Bases: NCEIBase

Stations are where the data comes from (for most datasets) and can be considered the smallest granual of location data. If the desired station is known, all of its data can quickly be viewed

Additional Query Parameters

datasetid [Optional]

Accepts a valid dataset id or a chain of dataset ids separated by ampersands. Stations returned will be supported by dataset(s) specified

locationid [Optional]

Accepts a valid location id or a chain of location ids separated by ampersands. Stations returned will contain data for the location(s) specified

datacategoryid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data category id or an array of data category ids. Stations returned will be associated with the data category(ies) specified

datatypeid [Optional]

Accepts a valid data type id or a chain of data type ids separated by ampersands. Stations returned will contain all of the data type(s) specified

extent [Optional]

The desired geographical extent for search. Designed to take a parameter generated by Google Maps API V3 LatLngBounds.toUrlValue. Stations returned must be located within the extent specified.

startdate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Stations returned will have data after the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of enddate

enddate [Optional]

Accepts valid ISO formated date (yyyy-mm-dd). Stations returned will have data before the specified date. Paramater can be use independently of startdate

sortfield [Optional]

The field to sort results by. Supports id, name, mindate, maxdate, and datacoverage fields

sortorder [ Optional]

Which order to sort by, asc or desc. Defaults to asc

limit [Optional]

Defaults to 25, limits the number of results in the response. Maximum is 1000

offset [Optional]

Defaults to 0, used to offset the resultlist. The example would begin with record 24

nautical.noaa.ncei.token module¶

nautical.noaa.ncei.token._load_from_json(filename)[source]¶

Search for the token in the json file

nautical.noaa.ncei.token._load_from_yaml(filename)[source]¶

Search for the token in the yaml file

nautical.noaa.ncei.token.get_default_token()[source]¶

Parse the default token information

nautical.noaa.ncei.token.get_token(filename='/home/bbarbach/personal/nautical/auto_doc_venv/lib64/python3.6/site-packages/nautical/noaa/ncei/token.yaml')[source]¶

Provide a yaml, json, or text.

For yaml files, the file must contain the keyword token followed by the token, token: {{ token }}

For json files, the file must contain the keywork token follwed by the token, {“token”: {{ token }} }

[Default Behavior]: For text files, simply copy the token into the file.

This file does not need to be considered a secret. Follow the link below to generate your unique (one time) token. https://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/cdo-web/token

The usage of a token is limitted to 5 times per second, and 10,000 times per day according to the noaa website.

Parameters:

filename – file containing the token data

Returns:

token contained in the file if exists, otherwise None
